lines.text: [Cadbury has just made a break from jail, and is reunited with Richie]
Cadbury?
Richie! Oh, thank God, I've been worried sick...!
[they hug each other]
I do beg your pardon, sir. All that emotion. Quite out of order. Got caught up in the moment.
Cadbury?
Yes, sir?
Shut up!
Thank you, sir.
Hey, man, just checking out your crib here.
My crib?
I believe that's street slang for home, sir, an idiom.
Who you callin' an idiom?
How do you put up with me, Regina?
Well, you do have $70 billion.
Is that the ONLY reason?

[she lightly gives him a smooch]
No. You also have a cute butt.
[she walks away sensually, and he looks embarrassed, and then chuckles]
Hey, Cadbury, did you hear that?
Indeed, sir. Madam admires your butt. I'm most delighted for you.

[on Prof. Keenbean's Smellmaster 9000]
Darling. We have Glasses to help us SEE better, and hearing aids to help us HEAR better. Why shouldn't we have something to help us SMELL better?
We do, dear. It's called Chanel.
Well... I'm already wanted for attempted murder, escaping from jail, and blowing up an aircraft. Breaking and entering sounds right up my alley. Let's kick some butt, shall we?
Let's!

[having forced Richard Sr. and Regina to open Mount Richmore, Van Dough finds that instead of money, it contains... baby pictures, comic books, baseball cards, finger paintings, and other bric-a-brac!]
Why, this is incredible! This is amazing! Why, this is -...
[gets disillusioned]
This is... this is junk!

[they both look insulted]
Junk?
What is this? Bronze dog bones? Accordians? Baby pictures, tricycles, kites...
[picks up a]
Bowling trophies?
Oh, do you remember that, darling?
Our first date!
What is all of this crap?
These are our treasured possessions!
But where's the gold... the diamonds... the negotiable bearer bonds? The money!
[points his gun at them]
WHERE'S THE MONEY?
In banks, where else? And the stock market, real estate...
No! Is this some kind of joke? You're telling me there isn't one single platinum bar, or emerald, or $1,000 bill in this *entire mountain*?
Well, I'm sorry to disappoint you, Lawrence, but that's not what we treasure.

[to Ambler]
Shoot them! Shoot them now, please!
NEVER mess with a man with sensitive teeth!
Excuse me, sir. It's a telephone call, from the President.
Which country?
This one, sir.
Probably needs another loan.
How do you rally the board of directors to your side AND stave off impending bankruptcy...? Reynolds?

[who has been reading a newspaper]
I'll have my secretary get back to you on that one.
See me after class, Reynolds. Ellsworth, how would you get the board on your side?

[who has been playing miniature golf]
Bribe someone.

[sighs]
Sit down, Ellsworth. Reginald, what would you do?

[who is being fitted by a tailor]
What would I do? Simple. I'd float a rumor that we're the object of a takeover bid. And as soon as our stock went up, I'd sell.
That's not only unethical, Reginald, it's illegal.
I'm only 12. I can't be held legally responsible.
Hmm, good point.
[after surviving a plane crash, they are on a raft in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean]
Well, that's it, honey. We're out of Perrier, the caviar's gone, and there's no more melba toast. The only thing we've got left is a bottle of Dom.
And this little pack of Bubblicious. Richie's favorite. He's only twelve years old, Richard. He's just a boy...
[She looks past him and notices something]
Oh, my God! We're saved!
What?
My Louis! Darling, my suitcase.
[It is floating nearby; In another scene, Richard Senior brings it aboard the raft, and they examine the contents]
My makeup case, my dresses, my Karl Lagerfeld, my Bill Blass...
My tuxedo. Now we can throw a dinner party - Wait a minute. Here's something we CAN use.
[He holds up a Remington "Microscreen" electric razor, and turns it on]
Richard, don't you think this is an odd time to start shaving your legs?
No, Regina. This is might be the very thing that saves us. The very thing. Yes!
Richard, darling, you've been too long at sea.
[he finds a lonely Richie surveying their backyard from the balcony]
Excuse me, Master Richie. Sensing you were at a loose end, I've arranged for a little entertainment.
I'm really not in the mood for the Vienna Boys' Choir today, Cadbury. Thanks anyhow.
You got a first name?
Of course.
And?

[pause]
Herbert.
Herb!
No, it's HERBERT. I'm not a seasoning.

[still lost at sea]
Richard, if we ever get out of this, I'm gonna soak for a week in a vat of Oil of Olay... Why haven't they found us yet?
Probably because the locator-transmitter in the plane is under a mile of water. So unless we find a Radio Shack out here at sea...
There's only one person ruthless enough to set off a bomb on our plane. When I get my fingers on him, I'll-...
Now, Regina, we don't know for sure who it was.
Oh, Richard, wake up and smell the seaweed.
[assuming that he knows she means Van Dough]
You should have fired him years ago!
Darling, I have never fired anyone in my life, and I don't intend to start now.
But, Van Dough!
[she shirks in disgust at him]
He thought Richie was on the plane with us.
[becomes a newsflash to both of them]
Regina, we have to survive! If only to warn Richie, his life could be in real danger.
[Richie wants to play baseball with Gloria's sandlot-team]
Come on. Let me hit.
Forget it; you probably couldn't even hit a BEACH BALL!
I could hit it off of YOU.

[insulted]
All right - You think you're so hot? Put your money where your mouth is!
You mean bet?
Yeah. $5 says she could put you away for keeps.
$5? How about $10?
Okay - Seems a little steep, but $10 thousand it is.
[He whips it out, and they all freak out]
No, not $10 thousand. $10 dollars.
Oh, $10 dollars. Okay.
Master Richie, I do think it unseemly in the extreme for you to take these - children's money.
What are you doing, Mr. Fancy Pants? Asking the old guy for batting tips?

[insulted]
Take their backsides to the cleaners, Master Richie.

[to the valet at private school]
This is a cappuccino. I asked for a DECAF CAFFE LATTE, you incompetent imbecile!
You and your parents are flying to London to take tea with Her Majesty... Is something amiss, sir?

[unhappy]
First, my friends are too busy to hang out with me... And now, *I'M* too busy to hang out with me.
[after the laser gun has destroyed the nose on her Mount Richmore carving]
Oh, my God, my nose! I look like Michael Jackson!

[frantically]
He's trying to kill us!

[calmly]
I know, dear.

[after Herbert pulls Diane close against his body to save her from being run over by the four-wheeling children]
Do I detect a rising fire sign, Herbert?

[Embarrassed pause]
You, Diane,
[sigh]
are a Capricorn.
Hey, how did you know that?
[last lines]
I must say, Regina, now our son really is the richest boy in the world.
He has friends.
Welcome to your worst nightmare.
[gulps in frightened anticipation of what he thinks will be something terrible and violent]
[ominously reveals a hand of cards, then smugly and confidently places a card on the table in front of him, unaware that Cadbury is a whiz at cards]

[in a relieved cheerful tone]
Ohhh...!
[holds up a strong/winning hand of cards]
Gin!

[rolls his eyes and scrunches up his face in total frustrated fury at his failure to win the game or intimidate Cadbury, then turns abruptly and batters his head violently against the metal-bar wall of his cell, giving a scream of maniacal rage each time his forehead hits the wall]
Ahhwwwwh... YUH! YUH! YUH! YUH! YUH! YUH! YUH!

[twisting his mouth gently and speaking in a quiet tone of sarcastic sympathy at the bully's cry-baby behavior]
Ohhhh... I'm sorrrrrrry...
That's not a house, it's a whole 'hood!
How come all we do is talk about money? Why don't we do something fun.
Money is fun!
Hey! Need a new bed pan? I know I do!
[upon seeing that Richie's adult-caliber schedule keeps him too busy to play with Gloria and her friends]
Poor kid.
Poor kid? What are you talking about? He's the richest kid in the world!
You don't have children, do you, Dave?
Mount Richmore? I did say that we needed a family portrait, Regina. But this?
Well, it was Rafaelle's idea. She's the artist. I didn't want to stifle her creativity.
Oh, honey. You know I'm all for the arts. But don't you think it's a tad pretentious to have our faces 100 feet high? Wait 'til Geraldo gets a hold of this!

[spraying his latest invention on a test dummy]
Now, THIS makes any fabric instantly impervious. Dirt proof, stain proof, water proof, and...
[calls out assistant with a gun]
Sherman!
[Sherman nods, as they go behind the glass wall behind, Sherman fires at the dummy who remains unharmed. As they reenter, Keenbean picks out a bullet that is still hot]
Ouch! And bullet proof! It's still not perfected yet! It's hell on the dry-cleaning bill.
No kidding.

[as he steps out of his limo and into a puddle]
37-and-a-half miles of driveway, and you park in the 5 feet with a puddle!
I'm very sorry, sir.
You're very sorry? Well, in that case, find another job.
What are we getting for it?

[incredulous]
What are we getting for it? Why, we're getting food banks, medical clinics, shelters for the homeless-!
Now, Regina, calm down! It's my job to keep an eye on the bottom line.
Which is why I have to oppose the United Tool acquisition. We should be getting rid of dead weight, not acquiring more.
I agree. That's why I am getting rid of United Tool...
Richard! All those people and their jobs!
That is brilliant. I should've thought of it myself. We buy the company in bankruptcy, level the factories...
No, I'm keeping the factory open.
Then we go in and bust the unions, slash benefits, and after that sell the company. Right?
No. We give it away.

[bangs his hand down on the table, and snaps his finger]
We git it a - -
[suddenly looks despaired]
We give it away.
Absolutely! We modernize it, of course, and retool. Then we turn the factory over to the workers.
[Richie and his private-schoolmates are on break from their fencing class]
Capital appreciation is all well and good, but not without a sound growth strategy.
pork bellies.
...I'm wondering if you guys can come over this weekend and hang out with me. Like normal kids do.
*Normal* kids? You're really acting weird, Richie. Anyway, no can do. I promised my dad I'd go with him for a hostile takeover in Tokyo.
Et tu, Ellsworth?

[shrugs]
Trustees' meeting. Sorry.

[introducing his latest invention]
This baby is the ultimate corrosive. I call it - DON'T TOUCH IT! - I call it "hydrochloricdioxynucleocarbonium". Well, the name needs work. But it'll eat through a Buick! OR -...
Prison bars.
Exactly.
Thank heavens! My teeth wear starting to grow fur.
[hums as he nearly brushes his teeth with Keenbean's super-corrosive "toothpaste"]
Oh! Talk about extra-strength tartar control.

[Richie is hiding out at Gloria's apartment]
I like this "street" look on you, Richie. If I didn't know better, I'd swear you were almost normal.
Thanks, I think.
No, seriously. I used to think you were just some spoiled rich kid. But now, you're not so bad.
Yeah, likewise.

[on Rich Industries' venture into the candy bar-business]
We simply cannot let our competition be nuttier than we are.

[to his long-suffering secretary, who's been rubbing his temples]
No, clockwise. I said, massage CLOCKWISE. Migranes are bad enough without your incompetence. Get out!

[They are boarding a plane bound for England]
Oh, Richard, you're not seriously considering giving the queen the Smellmaster for her birthday?
Why not, Regina? I think she'd get a kick out of it! Anything to take her mind off those children of hers.

[commenting on the size of Rich Manor]
This place probably's got its own zip code!

[They are preparing to depart for England]
Perk up, son. It won't be long before you're having tea and crumpets with the queen!
I'd much rather eat a hot dog at Wrigley Field.

[chuckles]
So would I, son. So would I.

[Richie prepares to introduce himself to Gloria and her sandlot-baseball team]
You can't play with THESE children. I must protest!
Cadbury, CHILL. I'll be fine.
But they probably haven't even been VACCINATED!

[to Gloria and her fellow sandlotters]
If any one of you guys wanna turn back, now's the time.
No way. Would you turn back if you were us? We're with you, Richie.
Come along sir, you mustn't keep your personal trainer waiting.

[getting out of bed]
Tell Arnold I really don't feel like excercising today.
[Cadbury clears his throat, and in walks in Claudia Schiffer. Richie's mouth drops open]
I hope you don't mind, but Arnold cancelled. So I'll be filling in. My name is Claudia.
Yikes!
[Wiggles his eyebrows. They start doing some basic excercises, and Richie and Cadbury are watching her]
Cadbury, about Arnold...
Arnold's history, sir.

[She bends over, and the two men are mesmorized]
All the way back down, stretch and back up.

[about to go on Richie's rollercoaster]
I just ate.
You always "just ate."

[Sniffs]
Hey man, you nervous or something?
No. Whaddaya talkin' about.
DID YOU FART?
Nah.
Man, you cut the cheese!
Whoever smelt it dealt it.
Well, whoever denied it supplied it.
Remember this, you have the power of your father inside you.
Sort of like "trust the force, Luke?"

[sniffs]
Good grief! Manure?
Hey, it's all we could find!
Very well. Load.

[into walkie-talkie]
I'm in position. You guys almost ready?

[sniffs, into walkie-talkie]
Eminently.

[the gang has managed to hit Nash with a bag of manure, knocking him out, and Cadbury speaks into it with a gruff voice, to try to cover up the situation]
Yeah, this is Nash. False alarm. Everything's slicker than the snot on a doorknob.
[the kids roll their eyes]
I heard it in prison.
Roger that.

[to himself]
I think those Twinkies are starting to rot his brain.
Are you a Sagittarius?
No, Madam.
Pisces.
No, Madam.
Leo!
No, I'm a Taurus.
I knew it! The bull...

[sigh]
Correct, Madam.

[as Regina is dangling from the glasses of Rich Sr's Mount Richmore face, being held onto by Richie and Rich Sr]
I'm gonna swing you into my mouth.

[frantically]
In you mouth?

[calmly]
In my mouth.

[frantically]
In your mouth?

[calmly]
It's large enough.

[looking up somewhat uncertainly at the enormous tall Rich Industries office building towering up in front of him]
I'm not sure if I can go through with this, Cadbury.
Just remember these words, Master Richie - - "You have the power of your father inside you."
You mean, like, "Trust the force, Luke"?

[maintaining his debonair composure even though he is a bit dismayed to have his elegantly-worded example "degraded" by having it merely compared to a quote in a science fiction movie]
"Pree-cisely, sir!"

[into walkie-talkie, with mouth full]
This is Nash.
Nash, I didn't hear that. Come back with that.
This is Nash.

[into walkie talkie]
Fire two!
[Cadbury launches a second sack of manure]

[mouth full]
Somebody throwing SHIII-!
[the sack knocks him out]
YES!

[taped to a chair]
AAAH!
[Ferguson rams Keenbean into wall and starts choking him]

[eating Keenbean's sandwich]
Come on, Professor, play nice. You think I'm enjoying this?

[gagging]
Yesss.

[while biting into a large deli meat roll]
My inventions!

[singing the passcode to open the family vault]
We ain't got a barrel of money.
Maybe we're ragged and funny.
But we'll travel along-singing our song-side by side.
Code accepted.
Thank you, Beavis and Butthead.

[in a tone of disgust and indignation as he and the rest of Richie's group are being herded into the molecular reorganizer]
After all that this family has done for you, and this is how you behave?

[in a lightly-casual sarcastic tone]
Well, yeah, so I guess I won't be getting that EMPLOYEE OF THE YEAR AWARD, after all, eh?

[seeing his gentle dignified friend clad in the would-be hitman's hideous punk-biker's costume of glossy black fabric imprinted with hundreds of tiny white human skulls]
You know, Cadbury, that get-up really doesn't go with your personality.
Yeah, I know. I was lucky to be able to hold onto my own underwear.

[seeing Cadbury disguised as the hoodlum]
Whoa, look who's slummin'!
Guess what, Professor? In 30 seconds, you won't even recognize your little friends anymore!

[while interrogating Professor Keenbean]
You told me what this machine can do to a person. How'd you like to spend the rest of your life as a bedpan?
the Sub-Atomic Molecular Re-Organizer!
[behind him, two tandem hopper cages full of garbage slowly advance towards a huge machine]

Useless garbage is broken down into its basic molecular components, which are then recombined to form a whole range of useful new products, from bedpans to bowling balls! Hey, need a new bedpan? I know I do!
[types "bedpan" into a computer]
It's quick, it's easy, and in no time at all... you've taken 50 lbs of yesterday's garbage and transformed it into a beautiful new bed... bowling ball!
[the machine begins ejecting bowling balls, one after another]

[after manhandling Richie]
It's my duty to protect him.
Yes,very well, Mr. Ferguson, but if you grab him like that again, it is YOU who will need protecting.
